definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°

sentences.english: Mrs. Dursley sipped her tea through pursed lips.
sentences.chinese: 德思礼太太嘬起嘴唇呷了一口茶。

sentences.english: Just slowly sip a glass of flat coke and it should help to alleviate nausea.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢呷完一满杯可乐，对缓解反胃有很大帮助。

sentences.english: She supped the hot tea Delia had brought her.
sentences.chinese: 她呷着迪丽娅给她端来的茶。

sentences.english: She pauses to sip a frothy iced coffee from a plastic tumbler.
sentences.chinese: 她停下来呷了一口塑料杯里浮满泡沫的冰镇咖啡。

sentences.english: I nodded to him and raised my drink and we both sipped at the drinks.
sentences.chinese: 我朝他点点头，举起酒杯，两人都呷了一口。

sentences.english: Now is the best time of the year to eat freshly harvested bamboo shoots.
sentences.chinese: 每一年这耶时阵是呷竹笋尚好耶时机。

sentences.english: He sipped his drink, staring intensely at me.
sentences.chinese: 他呷着饮料，两眼直盯盯地望着我。

sentences.english: The general situation of Gapa landslide is introduced firstly and then its sliding mechanism is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 先介绍了呷爬滑坡的概况，然后，分析其成因机制。

sentences.english: The president sipped at his drink.
The big prince shrugs and sips the liquid through the reed.
sentences.chinese: 大王子耸耸肩，通过芦苇呷着液体。

sentences.english: He swam several lengths, pushed along by Daisy's urgent quacking.
sentences.chinese: 在黛西呷呷的督促声中，他在浴盆里来回游了好几趟。

sentences.english: He swam several lengths, pushed along by Daisy's urgent quacking.
sentences.chinese: 在黛西呷呷的督促声中，他在浴盆里来回游了好几趟。
伯顿呷了一口杜松子香槟酒。

definition: the corners of the mouth/the lips
to sip/to smack one's lips/to taste/to savor
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
tea prepared in large quantity using inexpensive tea leaves
to drain the cup in one gulp (idiom)
